meanings.definition: The act of directing someone away from the correct path or target.
meanings.sent1: The magician used misdirection to make the audience look at his left hand while he performed the trick with his right hand.
meanings.sent2: The spy employed misdirection to lead the enemy agents astray and protect the classified information.
meanings.sent3: The misdirection in the treasure map led the pirates to a field of chickens instead of the buried gold.
meanings.sent4: Her misdirection in conversation made it difficult for others to understand her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The misdirection of the road signs caused many drivers to get lost in the maze of streets.

meanings.definition: A misleading or deceptive action or statement.
meanings.sent1: The con artist's misdirection convinced the victim to hand over all her savings.
meanings.sent2: The politician's misdirection during the debate avoided addressing the real issues at hand.
meanings.sent3: The misdirection in the magic show left the audience in awe of the impossible feats.
meanings.sent4: His misdirection in negotiations made it challenging for the other party to understand his true position.
meanings.sent5: The misdirection in the movie plot kept the viewers guessing until the very end.
